text: "Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word" is a 1976 song by Elton John. It was taken from his 11th studio album Blue Moves. It went to number 6 in the United States, number 3 in Canada and Ireland, number 11 in the United Kingdom and Australia and number 7 in New Zealand. ==Blue version== In 2002 British band Blue covered Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word for their second studio album One Love. It also featured Elton John for this duet. It went to number 1 in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Hungary and Scotland and made the top 10 in 16 additional countries except for Australia where it made only number 43. ===Track listings=== UK CD1 # "Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word" (radio edit) – 3:31 # "Lonely This Christmas" – 2:08 # "Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word" (Ruffin Ready Soul Mix) – 3:51 # Video interactive element – 3:30 UK CD2 # "Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word" (radio edit) – 3:31 # "Album Medley" – 5:44 # "Sweet Thing" – 3:38 # Video interactive element – 3:30 UK cassette single # "Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word" (radio edit) – 3:31 # "Album Medley" – 5:44 # "Sweet Thing" – 3:38 == Other websites == Category:1976 songs Category:1970s ballads Category:Elton John songs Category:Blue (group) songs Category:Joe Cocker songs Category:Ray Charles songs Category:Mary J.
